p: A. africana extracts possess significant anti-inflammatory properties [ 2, 19]. These properties can be attributed to the presence of a wide range of secondary metabolites, including flavonoids, saponins, and tannins ( Table 1). Several in vitro and in vivo studies have been carried out on A. africana extracts to determine their anti-inflammatory properties [ 2, 26]. A. africana fresh leaf extract is known for its wound healing potential, which is strongly linked to its anti-inflammatory activity that inhibits the synthesis of prostaglandins and neutrophil migration into the damaged tissues, reduces vascular permeability, and stimulates accumulation of lymphocytes, thus promoting the process of tissue repair [ 2, 19].
